Teacher: Of course, you may go. 
Student A: Thank you. 
Teacher: No problem. 
Student A: Eh, teacher, can I go to the bathroom? 
Teacher: Yes, you may go. 
Student A: Thank you.

1:
A: Aiyo, nearly hit leh, so scary ah!
B: Alamak, why you drive so fast?
A: You see lah, that driver in front of me suddenly changed lanes.
B: Wah, really dangerous sia. Good thing you were paying attention.
A: Yah, if not [confirm] accident already.

2:
A: "Hey, I heard you got your phone confiscated. What happened?"
B: "Yeah, some bastard snitched on me to the teacher. Now kena [lah] confiscate."
A: "That sucks. Who told on you?"
B: "I don't know, butok [lah] it was probably that busybody class monitor."

3:
A: Hey, have you seen my wallet?
B: No, I haven't.
A: Are you sure? Don't rat me out leh.
B: What do you mean? Did you lose your wallet?

4:
A: Good morning, ladies and gentlemen! Welcome aboard this flight to Singapore.
B: Hi there, thank you for the warm welcome. I've heard there will be duty-free sales on this flight?
A: Yes, that's right. We will be making announcements later on and our flight attendants will also be coming around to sell duty-free items.
B: Oh, that's great. I haven't bought anything from the airport yet, so I'll definitely buy from you guys, lah.
A: Sure, all the items are priced the same and it's confirmed, plus chop. Enjoy your flight!

5:
A: Hey, how was the physics test today?
B: It was out of the world, man.
A: Really? Did you do well?
B: No way, I think I flung that section on statics. What's the point of testing last year's work?
A: Yeah, that's true. GG liao lor.

6:
A: Did you hear about the news of Mahathir stepping down as Prime Minister?
B: Yeah, I did. Whatever his flaws may be, he was not a halfpast six leader.
A: I agree. But now with Pak Lah as the new leader, there are concerns about his leadership abilities.
B: That's true. All the king's horses and all the king's men cannot prove that he is not one.
A: What do you mean by that?
B: I mean, it's difficult to trust his leadership skills.

7:
A: Hey, have you read the latest article on Korean culture?
B: Yeah, I did. It's interesting how they have so many popular foods.
C: Of course lah, we all jakun. LOL.

8:
A: Hey, what's up?
B: My baby sneezed this morning.
A: Oh no, is he sick?
B: I don't know, but I think I should take him to the doctor [lah].
A: I think he's just fine, don't be so overly anxious.

9:
A: Hey, did you hear about the postal service in Singapore?
B: Yeah, I heard they stopped it already.
A: Cannot imagine lah. In Singapore, you strike you lose your job.
B: Ya, cannot agree. Buay song so liddat lor.
A: No postal service for now, right?
B: Also dunno how long some more. So pek chek.

10:
A: Hey, have you seen the new guy in our office?
B: Yeah, he's the one who just started today right?
A: Yup, that's him. I heard he used to be a model or something.
B: Wow, really? Wah, it's like being a movie star leh. So handsome.

11:
A: Hey, did you hear about the new law that allows females to choose their own life partner?
B: Yeah, it's about time!
A: But some people are saying it's wrong to let immature females make such a big decision.
B: Mampus lah, how can they say that? Everyone should have the right to choose who they want to be with.

12:
A: Hey B, have you ever thought about using protection?
B: Nah, I don't like how it feels.
A: But it's important to be safe, especially if you're not in a committed relationship.
B: I know, but it's just not as pleasurable, lah.
A: Well, it's better to be safe than sorry.

13:
A: Hey, did you hear about the new restaurant that opened up downtown?
B: Yeah, I heard it's supposed to be really good.
A: I was thinking of checking it out later.
B: Maybe we should make a reservation first, just in case.
C: Later it will be so unlucky lah.

14:
A: Hey there, how was your morning run?
B: It was great, but I'm exhausted [lah].
A: Well, you did run for an hour straight.
B: Yeah, I know [lah], but it's worth it for the endorphins.
C: Hey guys, what's up?
A: Just talking about B's morning run.
C: Oh, [lah] end of run [lah]. I can imagine how tired you must be.

B: Sure, here you go [lah].

A: Great, thanks for letting me know.

4:

A: Well, we'll also be selling duty-free items. You can buy from us if you haven't bought from the airport yet.
B: Oh, really? Is it the same price?
A: Confirm plus chop, lah.

B: Oh no, that sucks. 
A: Like wtf lawl. So I think I flung that section. GG liao lor.

6:
A: Mahathir was a strong leader, but he had his flaws.

7:

A: Really? I had no idea. I feel so jakun lah.
B: Haha, don't worry. We can all learn together and try it out. LOL.

B: What? Why?
C: Cannot be too careful lah, lor. Better safe than sorry.

A: I know, it's frustrating. No postal service for now. Also dunno how long some more.

10:

A: He's tall and has a charming smile. 
B: Wow, just like a movie star [leh]. So handsome.

12:

B: Yeah, I am. But I don't have a condom.
A: Oh, you should use one. It's important to practice safe sex.

A: I get what you mean, but it's better to be safe than sorry.

13:

A: Oh no, it's going to rain?
B: Yeah, later it will be so unlucky lah. I don't want to get caught in the rain.

14:
A: Hey, have you finished your run already?
B: Yeah, just completed it. But I think I'm going to take a break now.
A: Why? Did something happen?
B: Nah, just feeling a bit tired lah.
A: Oh, I see. Well, it's always good to listen to your body and rest when you need to. Take it easy, man.
